div.bibl: Krasnow Scrapbooks, Vol. I, owned by Dr. H. R. Krasnow, 4601 N. Broadway, Chicago, Ill.

body.p: The society "Enlightenment," 1115 N. Robey Street, near Division Street, is announcing that a series of lectures is arranged by the society. This list will end the series of lectures of our society.
All lectures begin at 8 P. M.
May 5: Dr. Rubinov, from New York, on the subject: "Socialism and the Government."
May 12: Jacob Feldmark, subject, "Government Section of the Russian Church."
May 26: Engineer Prilla, subject, "Idealistic Experiments of the Bolsheviks."
June 2: Dr. M. Sahud, subject, "Fundamental Reasons of European War, and the Justification of the United States for Entering this War."
All are requested to save this program, so that the hours, the days, the list of lecturers and the subjects of the lectures will be remembered. Other invitations will not be sent.
The members of the society "Enlightenment" are admitted free; outsiders pay ten cents for each lecture.
Note the address of our new quarters, 1115 N. Robey Street, phone HUMboldt 752.
(Ed. Note: No year given, probably in early years of Bolshevik regime.)
